metadata.title: CVE-2017-5200 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Salt-api in SaltStack Salt before 2015.8.13, 2016.3.x before 2016.3.5, and2016.11.x before 2016.11.2 allows arbitrary command execution on asalt-master via Salt's ssh_client.Users of Salt-API and salt-ssh could execute a command on the saltmaster via a hole when both systems were enabled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-cloud - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-common - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-master - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-minion - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-proxy - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-ssh - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-syndic - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: salt package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2017.7.4+dfsg1-1').
